Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How has your week been since we last spoke?
Hi, Ellie! It’s been a bit better, actually. I’ve been trying to focus on the things we discussed.
That’s wonderful to hear! What have you been working on?
I kept a sleep journal, and I’ve been writing more. It’s helped me process some of my feelings.
That’s fantastic! What insights have you gained from your sleep journal?
I noticed that I sleep worse on days when I’m really stressed about job searching. It’s like a cycle that feeds into itself.
That’s a valuable realization. Understanding the connection between stress and sleep can help you develop strategies to manage both. What do you think you can do to alleviate that stress?
I think I need to be more mindful about my job search, maybe set specific times to work on it instead of letting it consume my day.
That sounds like a great plan! Setting boundaries can help you feel more in control. Have you had any new developments in your job search?
I actually got a response from one of the places I applied to! They want to interview me!
That’s amazing news! How do you feel about that?
I’m excited but also really nervous. I just hope I don’t mess it up.
It’s completely normal to feel nervous before an interview. What strategies can you use to prepare and calm those nerves?
I think practicing answers to common interview questions might help. And maybe doing some deep breathing beforehand.
Those are excellent strategies! Practicing can boost your confidence, and deep breathing can help ground you in the moment.
I’ll definitely do that.
Great! How about your writing? How has that been going for you?
It’s been therapeutic. I’ve been writing about my feelings around the job search and my experiences with rejection.
That’s a powerful way to process those emotions. Have you found any patterns in your writing that surprised you?
Yeah, I realized I often write about feeling inadequate and comparing myself to others. It’s something I struggle with a lot.
Recognizing that pattern is a big step. How do you think you can challenge those thoughts of inadequacy?
I could remind myself of my strengths and accomplishments, like we talked about. Maybe even write those down and keep them visible.
That’s a great idea! Creating a visual reminder can help reinforce positive self-talk.
I’ll make a list and put it on my fridge or something.

Perfect! As we wrap up today, let’s summarize your goals for the upcoming week. You’ll prepare for your interview, continue your writing, practice deep breathing, and create a visible reminder of your strengths. Sound good?
Yes, that sounds like a solid plan!
Wonderful. I’m really proud of the progress you’ve made. Remember to be gentle with yourself, and I look forward to hearing how everything goes next time.
Thank you, Ellie! I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next week.
Bye!
